topics.learning_outcomes: Describe the composition of blood. Describe the functions of blood in the body. Describe how blood circulates in the body.
Describe features of pregnancy. Identify signs and symptoms of pregnancy.

subtopics: Health risks of early sexual debut
topics.learning_outcomes: Identify health and social consequences of teenage pregnancy. Identify health risks associated with early sexual debut.

List foods which are good sources of vitamins and minerals. Explain the importance of vitamins and minerals in a diet. Explain the importance of eating a variety of foods. Explain the importance of food labelling and packaging. Identify common deficiency diseases in the communities. Interpret children’s clinic cards in relation to dietary intake.
Explain how substance abuse can ruin the lives of people. Explain how substance addicts can be helped.

subtopics: Challenges of living with HIV and AIDS
topics.learning_outcomes: Describe the challenges of living with HIV and AIDS.
Describe the water cycle system. Describe the process of evaporation and condensation. State the effects of the water cycle in everyday life.

subtopics: Movement of water and mineral salts in plants
topics.learning_outcomes: Investigate how water and mineral salts reach the leaves. Describe the process by which plants make food. Test for the presence of starch in a leaf.

subtopics: Importance of cleanliness in livestock care
topics.learning_outcomes: Explain the basic needs of livestock. Explain the importance of cleanliness in the care of livestock. Find out the advantages of keeping livestock together. Find out the disadvantages of crowding livestock.
Identify the different types of vertebrate animals. Describe adaptations shown by vertebrate animals. Describe the life cycle of vertebrate animals. State ways of conserving vertebrate animals.

subtopics: Air has weight and occupies space
topics.learning_outcomes: Describe the composition of air. State the physical properties of air. Demonstrate that air has weight and occupies space.
Explain what sound is. Demonstrate how sound is produced. Describe how sound travels from one place to another. Demonstrate how the volume of sound can be increased.

Show the effect of pressure on objects. Explain why tools and implements should be sharp. Explain why water tanks are placed on a higher level. Demonstrate that air exerts pressure. Explain why pumping a bicycle tube becomes more difficult as the tube gets inflated.
State methods of communication. Explain the importance of communication. Describe how sound waves are used in communication.
